alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 12:54AM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of eastern Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1251 AM EST, Stream gauges along Lawson Fork Creek on the eastside of Spartanburg continue to show minor flooding. A slow, steady fall in the water level along this tributary is expected through the early morning hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spartanburg and Cedar Springs. - Flooding is most likely along Lawsons Fork Creek at Lake Forest Drive. Flooding may continue in low-lying areas from U.S. Highway 221 to Goldmine Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
